ENTRY 2 - DISPLAY DECISION:
Choosing tableType 'mean_rows' because these are numeric percentage fields (0-100) where comparing central tendency across items/treatments is most informative. Showing means (with median and SD) will summarize the typical percent and variability across respondents for each sub-item. Stats: ["mean","median","sd"]. Will generate 1 table containing 10 rows (2 rows per treatment, 5 treatments total).

Minor ambiguity: treatments beyond the first are not named in the provided labels, so I will label them generically as Treatment 1..5 (using the column index).

This looks like paired numeric allocations (e.g., previous/current or baseline vs future scenario) across the same set of treatments, i.e., a repeated-measures numeric grid where each treatment has two numeric variables.

Choosing tableType 'grid_by_value' because we have multiple items sharing the same categorical value set (1-4) representing rank positions.
